response.original_title: El manuscrito encontrado en la Zarazwela (Nos fera tu la pugnete)
response.overview: In 1977, José Ernesto Díaz-Noriega made a humorous and iconoclastic soundtrack version of Nosferatu, entitled 'Manuscript Found in Zarazwela' or 'Nos fera tu la pugnete'. Using a copy of the English version in Super 8, and "observing the curious coincidence of the fiction told in the film with history", Díaz Noriega adapted the vampire plot to the years of the Spanish Transition, turning Arias Navarro into Draculas Navarro, Juan Carlos de Borbón into Jonathan Carolus (prince of Franconia) and Santiago Carrillo into Jacobus Carrillus. The original Transylvania becomes Galicia and the Pazo de Meirás becomes the vampire's castle. All of Murnau's characters find an equivalence in the political actors of the Transition.
response.title: El manuscrito encontrado en la Zarazwela (Nos fera tu la pugnete)
